author: ca1f513d-3922-47cd-808c-84e91fbb1d11
lineage_statement:
GeoBC reviewed the start and end point for ferry routes identified in our digital road atlas (https://catalogue.data.gov.bc.ca/dataset/digital-road-atlas-dra-demographic-partially-attributed-roads) and created points where ferry terminal structures were visible on ortho imagery.

We reviewed the following sources to acquire and input attribute information:
a.	BC Ferries website (official terminal names, addresses, operator information for contracted terminals such as water taxis)
b.	Ortho imagery (number of berths)
c.	Seaspan website for Seaspan terminals
d.	Operator websites for Lady Rose and Get West adventure cruises (operators for passenger services on west coast of Vancouver Island)
e.	BC MoT website for inland ferry terminals
f.	Operator websites for water taxi services (e.g. Protection Island terminal in Nanaimo, Lund Water Taxi)
g.	Washington State and Alaska DoT websites for Washington State and Alaska ferries respectively

details.column_comments: TERMINAL_NAME is the name of the ferry terminal, e.g., Swartz Bay.
KEYWORDS contains text strings supplied by the Custodian, to be used for search/query purposes. Keywords are separated by the ; delimiter.
STREET_ADDRESS is a free form expression of the site descriptor (e.g., unit) and the civic building number / street / street indicator portion of an address, e.g., Unit 1, 123 Main Street East.

LOCALITY is the name of the municipality, community, Federal Indian Reserve (IR), subdivision, regional district, indigenous land or natural feature the occupant site is located in, e.g., Victoria, Saanich IR 1, Capital Regional District.
TERMINAL_OPERATOR is the operator responsible for the terminal (where available) , e.g., BC Ferries, Ministry of Transportation.
NUMBER_OF_BERTHS is the number of berths available.
VESSEL_SIZE_LIMIT is the largest vessel in Tonnes of displacement that the terminal can accommodate.
FERRY_TERMINAL_TYPE is the type of terminal, e.g., Vehicle Ferry, Passenger Ferry, Inland Ferry, Inactive.
MAILING_ADDRESS contains an address string, not a parsed address.  It is the address that will be displayed for presentation purposes, e.g., 32900 Marshall Road, Abbotsford, BC
WEBSITE_URL contains the link to the Home page of the Occupant's Website
IMAGE_URL contains a full URL link to a picture of the Occupant's Location.
LATITUDE is the geographic coordinate, in decimal degrees (dd.dddddd), of the location of the feature as measured from the equator, e.g., 55.323653
LONGITUDE is the geographic coordinate, in decimal degrees (-ddd.dddddd), of the location of the feature as measured from the prime meridian, e.g., -123.093544

PHYSICAL_ADDRESS contains the civic or non-civic address as a single string, structured according to the specification of the Physical Address and Geocoding Standard, e.g., 420 GORGE RD E, VICTORIA, BC.
DATE_UPDATED contains the date that the Occupant data was updated in the Occupant structure (system-generated)
SITE_GEOCODED_IND contains a Flag/indicator (Y/N) that the Occupant Physical Address has been geo-coded by the DataBC Address Geocoder and the results provide a valid site address, e.g., Y, N
SOURCE_DATA_ID is a unique occupant id either supplied by the source data system or produced by GSR, depending on the value of SUPPLIED_SOURCE_ID_IND
CUSTODIAN_ORG_DESCRIPTION contains the name or description of the custodial organization (usually Ministry and Branch)
BUSINESS_CATEGORY_CLASS designates the category of business, i.e., waterTransportationFerries
BUSINESS_CATEGORY_DESCRIPTION describes the category of business, i.e., Water Transportation Ferries
OCCUPANT_TYPE_DESCRIPTION contains the description of the occupant type, e.g. Hospital
SHAPE is the column used to reference the spatial coordinates defining the feature.

SEQUENCE_ID contains a value to distinguish occupant instances. Where a single occupant can have multiple instances (representing different services, for example), this field distinguishes this occupant instance from other instances of the same or different occupants.
SE_ANNO_CAD_DATA is a binary column used by spatial tools to store annotation, curve features and CAD data when using the SDO_GEOMETRY storage data type.

object_table_comments: GSR_FERRY_TERMINALS_SV is a spatially enabled layer comprising Ferry Terminals. Ferry Terminals is a point dataset identifying vehicle and passenger ferry terminals in British Columbia.
name: ferry-terminals

organization.description:
__GeoBC__ creates and manages geospatial information and products to help better manage natural resources in British Columbia. GeoBC also offers consultation services across all natural resource sector agencies.

__GeoBC__ has four areas of focus directly tied to natural resource business functions:
* Creating and maintaining a standard set of base spatial data that is open and accessible
* Providing direction and assurance for provincial land registries
* Offering Crown land and resource research expertise to other government agencies
* Delivering a service for custom solutions to natural resource business issues
organization.title: GeoBC
organization.full_title: Ministry of Forests, Lands, Natural Resource Operations and Rural Development, GeoBC
organization.name: geobc

notes: Ferry Terminals is a point dataset identifying vehicle and passenger ferry terminals in British Columbia.
title: Ferry Terminals
purpose: The primary use of this data is to provide locational information for ferry terminals in British Columbia.
